content.title: Cystic Adventitial Disease
content.description: Rare condition with mucin-containing cysts in arterial adventitia causing stenosis

key_concepts.details: Popliteal artery most common (85%); external iliac, femoral, radial also reported
Young to middle-aged adults; male predominance 5:1
Intermittent claudication; symptoms may vary with knee position (Ishikawa sign)
MRI shows cystic structure in adventitia; 'scimitar sign' on arteriography
CT-guided cyst aspiration, surgical excision, or bypass; recurrence possible

content.clinical_significance: Consider in young patients with atypical claudication and smooth stenosis
